thread.title: Stock futures flat as auto tariff threat dulls Fed optimism

title: Stock futures flat as auto tariff threat dulls Fed optimism
text:
May 24, 2018 / 11:57 AM / Updated 18 minutes ago Wall St. edges lower after North Korea summit canceled Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
NEW YORK (Reuters) - U.S. stocks ended down slightly on Thursday after President Donald Trump canceled a planned summit with North Koreaâ€™s Kim Jong Un and ordered a probe of auto imports, while gains in Netflix ( NFLX.O ) pushed its market value to a record. FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., May 21, 2018. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid
The Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI fell 75.05 points, or 0.3 percent, to 24,811.76, the S&P 500 .SPX lost 5.53 points, or 0.20 percent, to 2,727.76 and the Nasdaq Composite .IXIC dropped 1.53 points, or 0.02 percent, to 7,424.43. Reporting by Caroline Valetkevitch, editing by G Crosse
